skill.name: benchling-integration
skill.description: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflows via API, build Benchling Apps, query Data Warehouse, for lab data management automation.
skill.summary: Benchling R&D platform integration. Access registry (DNA, proteins), inventory, ELN entries, workflo...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing markdown reference files only. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls. All content describes legitimate Benchling API usage with security best practices included.

content.value_statement: Benchling is a cloud platform for life sciences research. This skill provides documentation and examples for integrating with Benchling API to manage DNA sequences, proteins, inventory, electronic lab notebooks, and workflows programmatically.
actual_capabilities: Access Benchling Python SDK documentation and examples
Learn authentication methods (API key, OAuth, OIDC)
Manage registry entities (DNA, RNA, proteins, custom entities)
Handle inventory operations (containers, boxes, locations, transfers)
Create and query electronic lab notebook entries
Automate workflow tasks and bulk operations
limitations: This is a documentation skill providing reference materials only
Requires separate Benchling SDK installation and configuration
Does not execute code or connect to Benchling directly

use_cases.title: Manage inventory
use_cases.description: Track samples, containers, and locations across your laboratory storage systems.

use_cases.title: Document experiments
use_cases.description: Create and link electronic lab notebook entries to biological entities and results.

use_cases.title: Import sequences
use_cases.description: Bulk import DNA and protein sequences from files into the Benchling registry.

prompt_templates.title: Get started
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I authenticate with Benchling using the Python SDK?

prompt_templates.title: Create sequences
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create and register a DNA sequence in Benchling.

prompt_templates.title: Manage inventory
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create containers and transfer samples to different locations?

prompt_templates.title: Automate tasks
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a workflow task and update its status using the Benchling API.

output_examples.input: How do I authenticate with Benchling using the Python SDK?
output: - Get your API key from Profile Settings in Benchling
- Use environment variables to store credentials securely

best_practices: Store API keys and credentials in environment variables, never hardcode them.
Use HTTPS for all API requests and rotate credentials regularly.
Apply the principle of least privilege when granting app permissions.
anti_patterns: Hardcoding API keys or credentials directly in source code files.
Committing credentials to version control repositories.
Using personal accounts for automation instead of service accounts.

faq.question: What programming languages work with Benchling?
faq.answer: Benchling provides a Python SDK and REST API. Any language with HTTP support can use the REST API.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the API?
faq.answer: Default limit is 100 requests per 10 seconds per user or app. The SDK handles 429 responses with automatic retry.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other systems?
faq.answer: Use AWS EventBridge for real-time event subscriptions. Query the Data Warehouse with SQL for analytics and exports.

faq.question: Is my data secure with Benchling API?
faq.answer: All API requests require HTTPS. Credentials are encrypted in transit. Follow security best practices for credential storage.

faq.question: Why am I getting 403 errors?
faq.answer: Valid credentials but insufficient permissions. Check user or app access to the organization, project, or folder in Benchling settings.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual Benchling usage?
faq.answer: API access mirrors your UI permissions. OAuth provides better audit attribution for multi-user applications than API keys.
